Punches in "latex" in the terminal.
>Please type in the name of your input file.

Me> thinking about the name...
Notices pdfTeX version, (3.14159265-2.6-1.40.20)

I go, woah that's the value of pi lol!, Goes on to check value of pi to confirm... Yeah it's correct... Haha that's pretty cool...

Sees question "value of pi till 100,000?" in Google search results... Checks it... Tries memorizing first 20 digits... Does it in one go and thinks I'm a genius...

Thinks... well... what's the highest someone has memorized?? Hmmm was it 126 digits or something??... well, then it wouldn't be that tough and people would be breaking the record every now and then lol...

Googles the question..."Guiness world record for highest no. Of digits of PI memorized"... Ahh, so it's a Japanese guy who memorized like 116000+ digits, damn...

In the recommendations, "how to memorize 100,000 digits of pi??" Video...hmmm, let's check it out ... Watches the video, just another cliche... "Researchers say... Memory athletes... Deck of cards ... Blah blah blah"...

Goes to comments... Snorts at few hilarious ones... *Snaps back to reality... "Shit, how did I get here?..."...

Retraces my path... Finds out I was supposed to write some article... And I was deciding the topic...

Checks terminal:
>Please type in the name of your input file. A2_C1.2_Illu |

cursor blinking at the line ... And I still have to decide the title...

And lo! Now I am documenting this whole event... GG!, 40 effing minutes elapsed...

Went to reddit as I was thinking of posting this in some sub...

Could not find an apt one and ended up mindlessly scrolling...

40 more minutes elapsed and I'm back to ground zero...

You know what? Fuck it, I'm just going to post THIS as an article ...
